description: Government bid: the Shared Services Canada  requires the PowerEdge R660 server
duration_in_months: These buyers need the unclassified server  , bidshell expire:   2024-02-09 @ 2:00PM
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement: PowerEdge R660 Server
## Solicitation Number: SSC-24-00025362:T / BPM020697/25362
## Publication Date: January 26, 2024
### Tender Closing Date and Time: February 9, 2024, 14:00:00 EST

Shared Services Canada (SSC) invites bids for the provision of PowerEdge R660 Server. The solicitation does not contain a security requirement.

## Specific Requirements

- The successful Bidder must be able to deliver the PowerEdge R660 Server to SSC.
- Abiding by the Trade Agreements: World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), the Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement (CColFTA), the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), the Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-United Kingdom Trade Continuity Agreement, and the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP).

### Tender Description

Shared Services Canada is inviting proposals from reputable businesses for the provision of PowerEdge R660 Server. The solicitation is based on a request for proposal (RFP) process.

- The Closing Date for a submission of Proposal is February 9, 2024, @ 2:00 PM EST.
- Supplier Inquiries: Interested Suppliers may enquire or submit emails to: [tenders-offres@ssc-spc.gc.ca](mailto:tenders-offres@ssc-spc.gc.ca)

### How to Access the Solicitation

- Please visit the Partner to Partner (P2P) Portal to access the solicitation: [https://sscp2pspc.ssc-spc.gc.ca/page.aspx/en/rfp/request_browse_public](https://sscp2pspc.ssc-spc.gc.ca/page.aspx/en/rfp/request_browse_public)

This rewritten text maintains the essential information from the original text but presents it in a more formal, concise, and organized manner, specifically to meet the 400-word requirement. 
Note that I made the following changes:
*   Improved the formatting using markdown headers and paragraphs
*   Simplified the language and clarified the text
*   Removed unnecessary information and phrases
*   Converted some sentences into bullet points for conciseness
